Wow, way to revive a dead thread. 
 
 LOTR is fantastic. Loved the books, and was really glad to see that the movie was done very well. Usually after reading something, I think the movie just doesn't do it any justice. But in this case, I would say: well done. Never saw HP, never read HP, probably never will. Prefer to keep it that way. What little I have heard and seen about HP seemed childish.

The basic problem here is that the two books have very different purposes.
 
 At first, I disliked Harry Potter, as the idea seemed childish. However, I eventually decided I'd better read it so as to be at least able to discuss it with others, and once I read it, it turned out as a very refreshing experience. While the gothic Warhammer universes have their attractive points, the constant mix of demons preying on wizards, ultracruelty and mass warfare does begin to brood a bit, and HP is just the counter for it. It's similar with epics like LOTR.
 
 Sometimes, you are in the mood for some epic grandness, and LOTR fits in perfectly. Sometimes, you're in a lighter mood, and you can really enjoy Potter. Mostly, you are simply bored and just want to read something to while away the time, and the better of the two is the one you have read fewer times so far...
 
 In the end, such universe versus universe arguments often forget one thing: one universe is not enough. You can get too much of it, and then, you turn to alternatives for a while.
In what parallel hell dimension does harry potter have a patch on the lord of the rings?
do u always say that?????????????????...what valid point are you making from stating that?????????
I posted in the other thread before I saw this one. Copy and paste seemed simplest thing to do. I'm simply voicing my opinion that Lord of the Rings far surpasses Harry Potter.

To each his own, I say.
 
 I like even bad movies like Alien versus Predator, I just put myself in the author's mentality, which lets me recognize what the authors wanted to do.
 
 Rationally, I consider myself better off that way. So many more things to have fun with...
